question: 超す
userAnswer: to{} surpass/be-better-than | go-{across | above} | get-{over | through} | <ja>引っ越す</ja> | <tag>hon:</tag>go/come
activeAnswer: to{} surpass/be-better-than | go-{across | above} | get-{over | through} | <ja>引っ越す</ja> | <tag>hon:</tag>go/come
sourceMnemonic: Because the hiragana ends with an <ja>う</ja> sound, you know this word is a verb. The kanji itself means <kanji>ultra</kanji> or <kanji>super</kanji> so the verb version is what happens when you do something ultra or super much. You start <vocabulary>to exceed</vocabulary> the amount you were meant to do it. If you ultra drive a car, you exceed the speed limit. If you ultra study, you exceed your brain capacity. Get it?
sourceReadingMnemonic: Who likes <vocabulary>to exceed</vocabulary> everything? Your <ja><reading>子</reading></ja> (<ja>こ</ja>)! Or you, when you were a <ja>子</ja>. No bedtimes, parents, or other limitations could stop you! You were able to go over them all!
